intro: Aeranthes ecalcarata, commonly known as the Cape iron plant, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its dark green, sword-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, pale green to yellowish flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is cultivated in gardens in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
